thread.title: James Clemens could be without QB Heath Burchfield for remainder of season
thread.title_full: James Clemens could be without QB Heath Burchfield for remainder of season

title: James Clemens could be without QB Heath Burchfield for remainder of season
text:
View/Post Comments 
The face of James Clemens football since the program's inception in 2012 may have played his last game as a Jet.Senior southpaw quarterback Heath Burchfield had surgery today in Birmingham for a broken finger that he suffered on his throwing hand during practice last Wednesday. He missed Class 7A, No. 3-ranked James Clemens' 28-0 win at Sparkman on Friday . It was the first game in Jets' history that Burchfield was not the starting QB. 
Burchfield has completed 55 percent of his passes for 1,072 yards, nine touchdowns and three interceptions this season, according to the team's Hudl page."Not sure," James Clemens coach Wade Waldrop said when asked if Burchfield is out of the season. "We'll see what happens and how well he can recover. He had it worked on and we'll see how it goes from there." So blessed to of been able to play this game for so long and give my all to JC. Love my team‚úàÔ∏èüèà get this win pic.twitter.com/5cuyD8m8G1 ‚Äî Heath Burchfield (@hburchfield07) October 16, 2015 
James Clemens (7-1) hosts Huntsville and Hamilton to close the regular season. The Jets have clinched the No. 2 seed in Region 4 and will host a first-round playoff game Nov. 6 against the No. 3 seed from Region 3, which will come down to Hoover, Vestavia Hills and Hewitt-Trussville.The 6-foot, 170-pound Burchfield is the son of former Auburn long snapper Ron Burchfield. The younger Burchfield was named second-team All-State last season after completing 173 of 259 passes for 2,421 yards, with 20 touchdowns and 10 interceptions while helping lead James Clemens to its first winning season and playoff berth. As a sophomore, he completed 179 of 302 passes for 2,616 yards, 19 TDs and seven picks, and was tabbed honorable mention All-State.Junior Joseph Arias stepped in for Burchfield against Sparkman and completed 13 of 23 passes for 93 yards, two touchdowns and no interceptions. So proud of my team tonight and @ariasjoseph015 coming in and throwing 2 TDs tonight. Defense with the first shutout in school historyüèà‚úàÔ∏è ‚Äî Heath Burchfield (@hburchfield07) October 17, 2015 
"He played well.," Waldrop said of Arias. " He did some good things. We expected him to. Had a couple of communication things that we've got to get a little bit better that hurt us on a couple of drives in the first half. He made a couple of big throws late and had good command of the offense. He had no turnovers, which was huge in your first start." 
Highlights from Burchfield's 271-yard performance vs. Mountain Brook 
Daniel Boyette covers Huntsville region high school sports for The Alabama Media Group and The Huntsville Times. Write to him at dboyette@al.com.
